title: Aluminum Rises to 3-Year High Amid Tight Supply
summary: Aluminum prices have reached a three-year high due to tight supply conditions, particularly influenced by China's aluminum output cap. This cap has led to increased alertness among major consumers regarding near-term supply tightness in physical markets. The price rise is also supported by robust demand and supply constraints.

title: Macro and Fundamentals Resonate Positively, Aluminum Prices Expected to Fluctuate at Highs
summary: Aluminum futures on the Shanghai Futures Exchange (SHFE) have shown a bullish trend, with prices fluctuating at highs. The technical indicators suggest a continued upward momentum, though caution is advised against potential pullbacks. Resistance levels are projected in the 21,400-21,580 yuan/mt range.

title: Cash Aluminium Climbs to USD 2852.5/t on LME
summary: The cash price of aluminum on the London Metal Exchange (LME) rose to USD 2852.5/t, with a 0.33% increase. This rise is accompanied by a decrease in warehouse stocks by 4550 tonnes. The reduction in inventory levels supports the upward trend in aluminum prices.

title: NioCorp and IBC Advanced Alloys Successfully Cast Aluminum-Scandium Alloy
summary: NioCorp and IBC Advanced Alloys have successfully cast a 0.2% Aluminum-Scandium alloy, marking a potential expansion into Al-Sc alloy parts. This development is part of NioCorp's broader efforts to enhance domestic critical mineral production. NioCorp is hosting an investor webcast to discuss recent milestones and future plans.

title: NioCorp to Conduct Live Investor Webcast
summary: NioCorp is conducting a live investor webcast to update on its Elk Creek Critical Minerals Project and recent corporate milestones. The company has raised significant funding and is working to secure additional financing for project development. The webcast will include a Q&A session with management.

title: Domestic Aluminum Billet Inventory Rises
summary: According to SMM statistics, domestic aluminum billet inventory in two regions has increased to 102,000 mt. This update reflects recent trends in aluminum stock levels and market dynamics.

title: INALUM Signs Key Agreements at Osaka Expo 2025
summary: INALUM has signed significant agreements at the World Expo 2025 in Osaka to globalize its downstream aluminum strategy and boost the green economy. These agreements aim to enhance aluminum production and distribution capabilities.

title: Found Energy begins real-world test of zero-carbon reactor
summary: Found Energy, a Boston-based startup, is conducting the largest aluminium–water reactor test to convert scrap aluminium into zero-carbon industrial fuel. The 100-kilowatt reactor will be installed at a US tool manufacturing plant to produce heat and hydrogen, aiming to reduce industrial emissions through a circular waste-to-fuel model.

title: North American Green Aluminium Summit 2025
summary: The North American Green Aluminium Summit 2025 will focus on aluminium's role in carbon reduction, featuring discussions on decarbonisation technologies, recycling, renewable energy integration, and innovations in aluminium die casting technology. The event aims to promote sustainable transformation and expand aluminium recycling capacity in North America.

title: ALUMINIUM 2026: Driving Innovation for a Sustainable Future
summary: ALUMINIUM 2026 trade fair in Düsseldorf will emphasize sustainability with a focus on secondary aluminium for decarbonisation. The event will cover metal processing, recycling, automation, and cross-sector applications, featuring an expanded Sustainability & Recycling Conference to share expert knowledge and best practices.

title: The future of US aluminium hinges on energy, not tariff policy
summary: US aluminium production revival depends more on affordable electricity than tariffs, as energy costs constitute nearly 40% of production expenses and 80% of emissions. US industrial electricity rates are currently higher than in hydro-rich Canada, posing a challenge to sustainable domestic aluminium manufacturing.

title: Steel rose to 3,054 CNY/T on October 24, 2025, up 0.46% from the previous day
summary: Steel prices increased slightly to 3,054 CNY per tonne on October 24, 2025, marking a 0.46% rise from the previous day. However, over the past month, steel prices have fallen by 0.75% and are down 5.83% compared to the same time last year. Steel is expected to trade at 3,022.85 Yuan/MT by the end of the quarter and 2,890.00 Yuan/MT in 12 months.

title: HRC Steel Hits 4-week High
summary: Hot-Rolled Coil (HRC) Steel prices increased to 832.00 USD/T, the highest since August 2025. Despite a slight 0.24% loss over the past 4 weeks, HRC steel prices have increased 13.64% over the last 12 months.

title: US scrap trends outlook: October 2025
summary: Ferrous scrap prices in the US are expected to decline further in October 2025, continuing a downward trend from September. The market sentiment is bearish due to softening demand, with a forecasted 3.6% month-on-month decline in scrap prices. Market participants cite lower demand as the primary driver, with inventories slightly below average and no supply constraints to support prices.

title: worldsteel Short Range Outlook October 2025
summary: Global steel demand in 2025 is projected to be flat compared to 2024 at about 1,749 million tonnes, with a modest rebound of 1.3% forecast for 2026. The outlook is cautiously optimistic despite global trade tensions, supported by infrastructure investments and easing financing conditions. Growth is expected to come from developing economies and a return to demand growth in Europe and the US.

title: Steel prices hit 5-year low! Value drops sharply; top factors for steep fall
summary: Domestic steel prices in India have fallen to a five-year low, trading between Rs 47,000 and Rs 48,000 per tonne. This sharp decline is attributed to various market factors impacting demand and supply dynamics in the steel sector.

title: Steel imports fall 29% in H1, but sector still records net forex outflow
summary: Local steel prices have slumped to a five-year low, trading in the range of Rs 47,000-48,000 per tonne for hot rolled coil. Despite the fall in imports by 29% in the first half of the year, the steel sector continues to record a net foreign exchange outflow.

title: Brazil's Usiminas expects steel import slowdown, warns about China shipments
summary: Brazilian steelmaker Usiminas reported a third-quarter net loss and expects a slowdown in steel imports. The company also issued warnings regarding steel shipments from China, reflecting ongoing market challenges and competitive pressures.

title: Steel Ministry to hold talks with industry stakeholders on import issues on October 27
summary: The Ministry of Steel in India will conduct an Open House meeting on October 27, 2025, to discuss import-related issues with industry stakeholders. The meeting aims to address concerns and formulate strategies to stabilize the domestic steel market.

title: Ministry to hold Open House on steel import issues on October 27
summary: The Ministry of Steel will conduct an Open House on October 27, 2025, to discuss issues related to steel imports. Companies and associations can present their concerns during the event. Participation requires prior registration via email.

title: Steel imports fall 29% in H1, but sector still records net forex outflow
summary: India's steel imports have decreased by 29% in the first half of the year, yet the sector still experiences a net foreign exchange outflow. This indicates ongoing challenges in the domestic steel industry.

title: China proposes more stringent steel capacity swap plan to curb overcapacity
summary: China has proposed a more stringent steel capacity swap plan to address overcapacity issues in the industry. This plan follows the pause of a previous program that failed to achieve its goals.

title: Hebei Songting Steel to Start Blast Furnace Shutdown on Oct 27
summary: Hebei Songting Steel is set to begin a blast furnace shutdown for maintenance starting October 27. This shutdown is part of routine maintenance to ensure operational efficiency.

title: Experts urge factories to produce 100% refined steel to cut carbon emissions
summary: Industry experts are calling for factories to adopt 100% refined steel production as a key measure to reduce carbon emissions. This push aligns with broader efforts to decarbonize the steel sector and promote sustainability in manufacturing.

title: Reinventing Steel for a Stronger, Lighter, Greener Future
summary: Next-generation steel innovations are transforming construction with stronger, lighter alloys and low-carbon manufacturing processes. The article highlights how green steel is enabling sustainable building designs and reducing the industry's carbon footprint through advanced materials and hydrogen retrofitting.

title: SteelDays Celebrates Sustainability
summary: SteelDays spotlights innovations and leadership in making steel a sustainable choice. The event highlights cutting-edge mills and technologies that contribute to steel's role in sustainable construction and environmental responsibility.

title: Greece's New Copper-Gold Mine Nears Completion, LME Copper Rose Sharply on Friday
summary: LME copper prices rose 1.2% to close at $10,947/mt on Friday, with trading volume and open interest increasing. Canadian company Eldorado Gold announced its Skouries copper-gold project in Greece is about 70% complete, with first production expected in early 2026 and commercial production by mid-2026.

title: Copper Prices Remain Near Record Highs
summary: Copper prices are holding near record highs just below $11,000 a tonne, driven by concerns over supply disruptions such as the suspension of Freeport-McMoRan’s Grasberg mine in Indonesia after a fatal mudslide. The metal has rallied about 25% this year, reflecting strong demand and supply-side challenges.

title: Metals on fire: What's driving the unstoppable rally in copper, aluminium and zinc
summary: Copper prices have surged past $10,000 on the LME and are near record highs on India's MCX platform, driven by supply disruptions at major mines, strong demand from infrastructure and green energy sectors, and geopolitical tensions. The rally is supported by factors including accidents at Chile's El Teniente mine, protests in Peru, and a mudslide at Indonesia's Grasberg mine.

title: Copper jumps to 16-month high on trade deal optimism
summary: Copper prices climbed to a 16-month high driven by optimism over a potential U.S.-China trade agreement, reflecting positive market sentiment on easing trade tensions between the two largest economies.

title: Copper rose to $5.16 USD/Lbs on October 27, 2025, up 1.42% from the previous day
summary: Copper prices increased to $5.16 per pound, up 1.42% from the previous day, with a 6.23% rise over the past month and an 18.92% increase year-over-year. Analysts expect copper to trade at $5.20 per pound by the end of the quarter and $5.74 in 12 months.

title: Greece's New Copper-Gold Mine Nears Completion, LME Copper Rose Sharply on Friday
summary: Canadian mining company Eldorado Gold's Skouries copper-gold project in northern Greece is about 70% complete, with first production expected in early 2026 and commercial production by mid-2026. The project has a designed mine life of about 20 years and aims to produce approximately 140,000 ounces of gold and 67 million pounds of copper annually. Copper prices on the LME rose sharply recently, reflecting market optimism.

title: Copper Prices Remain Near Record Highs
summary: Copper prices are holding near record highs, just below $11,000 per tonne, driven by concerns over supply disruptions. A key factor is the suspension of operations at Freeport-McMoRan’s Grasberg mine in Indonesia after a fatal mudslide, impacting the world's second-largest copper mine. The metal's strong rally this year reflects rising global demand and supply-side challenges.

title: Diablo Resources (ASX:DBO) Confirms Copper Mineralisation Open in All Directions at Phoenix Project
summary: Diablo Resources reported early drilling success at its Phoenix Copper Project in Utah, USA, with significant copper mineralisation confirmed open in all directions and at depth. Maiden drilling returned 10.5 metres at 1.02% copper, including a high-grade interval of 1.5 metres at 3.99% copper. Follow-up drilling is planned for mid-November, targeting further exploration in this recognized copper district.

title: Trump Copper Smelter Emissions Rule Reversal Explained
summary: The Trump administration reversed Biden-era copper smelter emissions rules, granting a two-year exemption to protect domestic processing. The US processes less than 5% of global copper despite significant mining, relying heavily on foreign smelters, especially in China, which controls about 50% of global copper smelting capacity. This reversal highlights strategic concerns about supply chain security amid rising copper demand driven by clean energy and electric vehicle growth.

title: FireFly Announces Major High-Grade Copper and Gold Exploration Breakthrough at Green Bay
summary: FireFly Metals reported exceptional drilling results at its Green Bay Copper-Gold Project in Canada, revealing a high-grade mineralised core over at least 800 meters strike length. Recent assays include 43 meters at 7.6% copper equivalent and 15 meters at 16% copper equivalent, indicating significant potential to expand the mineral resource. Ongoing drilling aims to define the full extent of this core for upcoming resource updates.

title: Copper Miner Sandfire Tracks Ahead of Plan in Strong First Quarter
summary: Sandfire Resources produced 21,800 tonnes of copper-equivalent in the first quarter, representing 23% of its 2026 financial year guidance. This performance reflects planned mining activities and positions the company well for the remainder of the year. The strong start indicates robust operational execution in copper production.

title: Corruption Probe Underway at Rio Tinto's Mongolian Copper Mine
summary: An internal investigation into allegations of corruption and unethical conduct is underway at Rio Tinto's Oyu Tolgoi copper mine in Mongolia. The probe involves procurement-related activities and has sought law enforcement cooperation. Oyu Tolgoi is a major copper and gold deposit expected to become the world's fourth-largest copper mine by 2030, critical to Rio Tinto's strategic shift toward copper production.

title: Trump Reverses Biden-Era Rules on Copper Smelters
summary: US President Donald Trump reversed a Biden-era air pollution rule that imposed stricter emissions limits on copper smelters. This regulatory change aims to ease restrictions on domestic copper processing, addressing concerns about supply chain resilience and domestic capacity limitations. The move reflects ongoing tensions between environmental regulations and industrial policy in the copper sector.

title: Hellenic Copper Mines Ltd: 2026 Outlook For Large Copper Mines
summary: Hellenic Copper Mines Ltd is advancing innovation and sustainability in copper mining through automation, AI-powered resource management, advanced recycling, and digital traceability. The company focuses on energy-efficient operations, enhanced waste management, and compliance with stringent EU environmental standards to boost productivity and minimize environmental impact.

title: Gold, Silver & Copper: tech and sustainability trends
summary: Copper companies are addressing supply challenges by adopting digital innovations, AI, satellite technology, and advanced mineral processing to optimize recovery and productivity. Recycling plays a key role, with recycled copper accounting for 32% of global supply in 2023, and companies increasingly collaborating with cleantech firms to enhance sustainable copper supplies.

title: How a New Jersey startup found an electrifying way to slash copper costs
summary: Still Bright, a New Jersey startup, has developed a novel copper extraction technology that recovers nearly all copper from ores without harmful pollution or pre-processing losses. Their method can also process tailings, recovering copper that traditional mining leaves behind, potentially reducing the need for new mines and lowering environmental impact.

title: CMOC Group's Strategic Expansion in Congo and Its Implications for Energy Transition Metals
source: AI Writing Agent via Resourcing Tomorrow
summary: CMOC Group is investing $1.08 billion in the Democratic Republic of Congo to boost copper output by 100,000 tons annually, supporting the global energy transition. The project balances growth with sustainability, aiming to meet rising copper demand amid geopolitical and ESG risks, reflecting the metal's critical role in green economy supply chains.

title: Trump reverses Biden-era rules on copper smelters
summary: US President Donald Trump reversed a Biden-era air pollution rule that imposed stricter emissions limits on copper smelters, providing a two-year exemption. This regulatory rollback impacts environmental standards in copper production and may affect sustainability efforts in the sector.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel Prices Rise Slightly on October 27 as China-US Economic and Trade Consultations Make Positive Progress
summary: On October 27, the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaged 122,900 yuan/mt, up 750 yuan/mt from the previous day. Positive progress in China-US economic and trade talks and lower-than-expected US CPI data boosted market sentiment, supporting a slightly higher nickel price with expected sideways movement in the near term.

title: [SMM Nickel Daily Review] Nickel Prices Rebounded on October 24 as the Fourth Plenary Session Sent Positive Signals
summary: Nickel prices rebounded on October 24 with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 122,900 yuan/mt, up 750 yuan/mt from the previous day. The Fourth Plenary Session's communique suggested future measures to stimulate domestic demand and industrial upgrading, providing short-term support despite weak fundamentals and volatile external environment.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices fell 1.8% to $15,235 a ton on the LME, hitting a four-year low due to a gloomy outlook from the Federal Reserve despite potential mining quota cuts in Indonesia. Indonesia is considering cutting nickel ore mining quotas sharply next year to support prices, but the market remains pressured by weaker electric vehicle sales and expectations of fewer Fed rate cuts.

title: Nickel - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Nickel price rose slightly to $15,334.13 per ton on October 27, 2025, up 0.06% from the previous day. Despite a modest monthly increase, prices remain about 4-5% lower than a year ago. Forecasts suggest nickel may trade around $15,152 by the end of the quarter but could decline to about $14,420 in 12 months.

title: Nickel prices remained decidedly bearish throughout October, experiencing the largest monthly decline amongst base metals
summary: Nickel prices have been in a strong downtrend throughout October 2025, falling over 7% and hitting the lowest levels since October 2021. The nickel market remains the worst-performing base metal this year, with significant year-to-date declines driven by oversupply and weak demand.

title: Nickel Breakout Looms as Indonesia Tightens Supply Ahead of 2026
summary: Analysis suggests nickel prices have been trading in a range but may be poised for a breakout due to Indonesia tightening nickel ore supply ahead of 2026. Ore prices have recently increased, supporting potential upward momentum in nickel prices.

title: METALS-Copper jumps to 16-month high on trade deal optimism; nickel rose 0.25%
summary: On October 27, nickel prices rose by 0.25% amid broader positive market sentiment driven by optimism over trade deals. This modest increase aligns with gains in other base metals like copper and tin.

title: SPC's polymetallic Muskox treads the path of giants
summary: SPC Nickel has completed a comprehensive field program at the Muskox Project in Nunavut, Canada, including the most thorough modern geophysical survey ever flown over the intrusion. The project shows promising high-grade silver and significant nickel-copper resources, with a 1km trend of high conductivity EM targets identified for potential drilling.

title: [SMM Nickel Daily Review] Nickel prices fluctuated slightly on October 23
summary: Nickel prices showed slight fluctuations with the SMM #1 refined nickel price averaging 122,150 yuan/mt. Market movements were influenced by geopolitical developments, including expectations of a US-China trade agreement and discussions on export controls on rare earths between China and the EU.

title: Nickel mining damage near UNESCO site stirs outrage in southern Philippines
summary: Nickel mining operations near a UNESCO site in the southern Philippines have caused significant environmental damage, including deforestation of about 200 hectares. The provincial government plans to suspend mining activities due to the environmental destruction and its impact on local infrastructure development.

title: China, ASEAN to upgrade free trade, bring more certainties to world
summary: A new project covering the full supply chain from nickel mining and processing to battery materials production, manufacturing, and recycling is underway, aiming to strengthen trade and industrial cooperation between China and ASEAN countries.

title: Trump Strikes Strategic Critical Minerals Trade Deals in Southeast Asia
summary: Former President Trump secured critical minerals trade deals in Southeast Asia, focusing on strategic partnerships that include nickel among other critical minerals, to support supply chains for commercial and defense industries.

title: Unleashing sustainable nickel production for a net zero future
date: Not specified (latest update likely recent, but not within the past 24 hours)
summary: The article explores how optimizing nickel production, particularly through High Pressure Acid Leaching (HPAL), can reduce the environmental impact and carbon footprint compared to other metals. It highlights ongoing efforts in pollution prevention, biodiversity conservation, and the need for greater transparency, energy efficiency, and responsible supply chain management to further improve sustainability in the nickel industry.

title: Nickel Institute seminar and cocktail reception - 2025
summary: This event focused on how circularity, evolving recycling practices, and sustainability frameworks are reshaping the future of nickel. Discussions emphasized the role of innovation in recycling and sustainable practices to meet future demand.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali launches pilot phase of green hydrogen project
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali, a leading Italian steel producer, has initiated the pilot phase of its green hydrogen project at its Aosta plant. The project uses a 1.008 MW Anion Exchange Membrane electrolyzer to produce 165 tons of green hydrogen annually, aiming to reduce carbon emissions and power one of its 70 furnaces entirely. This initiative is supported by €7.9 million funding from Italy’s National Recovery and Resilience Plan.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Cogne Acciai Speciali launches green hydrogen pilot plant
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali has started operations at a pilot plant in Aosta, northern Italy, focused on producing green hydrogen. This step aligns with the company's commitment to sustainability and reducing fossil fuel use in steel production.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali: 94% of the energy used comes from renewable sources and 93% of employees have permanent contracts
summary: On World Environment Day 2025, Cogne Acciai Speciali released its first Group Sustainability Report highlighting that over 94% of its electricity consumption comes from certified renewable sources. The report emphasizes the company's commitment to sustainability as a core part of its corporate strategy and long-term value creation.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali enters long-term molybdenum supply agreement
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding for long-term molybdenum supply, supporting its position as a global leader in special and stainless steel products. This agreement is part of broader strategic moves in the specialty steel sector.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italian steel factory invests USD 14 mln in training center in Romania
summary: Italian steel company Tenaris invested USD 14 million in a training center for its 1,700 employees in Zalau, Romania. The investment aims to strengthen medium and long-term operations despite global challenges, with support from Romanian government officials and Tenaris leadership.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: At the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, Tenaris highlighted its steel solutions tailored for power generation, emphasizing quality, innovation, and sustainability. The company collaborates with Macchi to provide high-performance tubular products designed for demanding industrial applications, including advanced manufacturing capabilities in Romania.

title: Tenaris hosts panel on nuclear energy and Italy's boilermaking future
summary: Tenaris organized a panel in Italy discussing the future of the boilermaking industry with a focus on nuclear energy's role in Europe's energy transition. The company’s Italian mill recently gained accreditation to supply certified materials for nuclear facilities, underscoring its commitment to quality and safety in advanced energy sectors.

title: Tenaris Completes $600M First Phase of $1.2B Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris completed the first $600 million tranche of its $1.2 billion share buyback program, purchasing over 33 million shares. The company plans to cancel all treasury shares acquired under this program, reflecting a strategic financial move amid market conditions.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian has been awarded a tender by Terna S.p.A. and STEG for the construction of a submarine power interconnection between Italy and Tunisia as part of the Elmed Project. The contract could reach a value of around €460 million and involves laying a power cable between Sicily and the Tunisian Cap Bon peninsula at depths up to 800 meters. This project aims to enhance energy security between Europe and Africa and supports the transition to cleaner energy.

title: Will Prysmian's Shift to Recycled Copper Amid Tariffs Impact Its Business?
summary: Prysmian has increased its use of recycled copper in the U.S. due to ongoing trade tensions and tariffs affecting the copper supply chain. This strategic shift aims to mitigate input cost volatility and maintain operational resilience. The move is part of Prysmian's broader efforts to adapt to global copper market disruptions while supporting its competitive position in cable production.

title: Prysmian (BIT:PRY): Examining Valuation as Recycled Copper Strategy Advances
summary: Prysmian is increasing its use of recycled copper in the U.S. amid trade tensions and tariffs, which complicate copper supply chains. This strategy supports Prysmian's growth in electrification and grid modernization, particularly in the U.S. market where tariffs provide a competitive advantage. However, potential rollback of tariffs could impact profitability and growth assumptions.
